ygData.subject: Re: Twisting question
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I have 100 CHA, also, and being Level 11, I rarely miss notes in Anthem, Hymn or Dissonance.  If i m lucky I can twist all three. However, Kelin s and
ygData.messageBody:
NeXuS wrote:
> The Higher the Charisma the less youll stutter a song. I put Cha to 100 and
> dex to 100 (Half-Elf) and put the remaining to Str. I hardly ever miss a
> note.
I have 100 CHA, also, and being Level 11, I rarely miss notes in
Anthem, Hymn or Dissonance. If i'm lucky I can twist all three.

However, Kelin's and Cinda's have an annoying habit of missing notes
LOTS. One time I hit Cinda's 11 times before it took. Not that it
did much.

So, now it seems that my extra points into CHA weren't such a waste
after all! 8)

Mully
Veeshan

>
> Koden
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Roop Dirump <roop@...>
> To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Monday, May 03, 1999 7:14 PM
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: Twisting question
>
> > From: "Roop Dirump" <roop@...>
> >
> > Wow, you say you only succeed beginning a song less than one third of the
> > time? Something definitely sounds amiss! And irritating, at that!
> >
> > What are all your stats? I always thought charisma would have a bearing
> on
> > it, but you stated you increased that with dex and strength at character
> > creation. It is quite likely dexterity as no bearing on musical skills,
> > yours being so high. Do you have any exceptionally low stat???
> >
> > (I have no idea the formula used to determine when a song can be
> > successfully started, but I do know that the singing skill or instrument
> > skill will effect the strength of a song, ie. Hymn of Restoration heals
> more
> > and more the higher one's string skill.)
> >
> > Roop
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Reece, Tom CPT - 30th Signal Bn <ReeceT@...>
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
> > Date: Monday, May 03, 1999 8:31 PM
> > Subject: [eqbards] Re: Twisting question
> >
> >
> > >From: "Reece, Tom CPT - 30th Signal Bn" <ReeceT@...>
> > >
> > >My success rate for twisting songs with a 95 DEX and 45
> singing/instrument
> > >skill is probably less than 33%. I'll start keeping track and see if I
> can
> > >come up with an actual % rate instead of an estimate.
> > >
> > >When I get the message "You missed a note", I do keep pushing the song
> > >button but usually I just keep getting the same message. Only when the
> > >first song runs out do I get to start another one.
> > >
> > >Galtin
> > >
> >
> >
